Privacy Policy</h1>

Privacy refers to information we obtain about you and the use we make of it in the course of our business. If you don't find your concern addressed here, feel free to contact us by e-mail</a> or via the Contact Us page</a> on this site.</p>

When I Visit Your Website, What Information Do You Gather About Me?</strong></h6>

One of the basic principles we've followed in designing this website is that we ask for only the information we need to provide the service you've requested. As a result, the answer to this question depends almost entirely on how you choose to make use of our websites and the growing list of website services. Currently, some website customers provide information in order to take advantage of the following services:</p>

Ticket Sales</strong>
Name, address, phone, e-mail, and debit/credit card information are necessary for purchase. Please note that debit/credit card information is not stored beyond the period of transaction and that such details are handled securely by TicketSource Limited.</p>

Gold Membership</strong>
Name, address, and e-mail are held to send your Certificate of Membership and any paper correspondance to you. Your date of birth is required for informational purposes only. No financial details are to be held by us, and should only be handled by your bank or building society.</p>

The Edinburgh University Music Society is committed to protecting the privacy of users of this web-site. We do not provide access to your information to any other organisation.</p>

What Are Cookies And Do You Use Them?</strong></h6>

Cookies are small tags, stored in your browser, which allow us to identify you as you move through the site. The site will record and retain visitors’ IP addresses, and visitor behaviour will analysed through Google Analytics.</p>

The Edinburgh University Music Society takes reasonable steps to ensure that data transmitted electronically to the Edinburgh University Music Society via the site or otherwise and stored by the Edinburgh University Music Society is not accessed by unauthorised third parties in accordance with the requirements of the Data Protection Act 1998.</small></p>
